# Xiaohongshu Style Preset

> **Purpose**: Conversational, friendly, engaging tone for casual educational content

---

## Characteristics

### Tone
- Warm and friendly
- Conversational, like talking to a friend
- Enthusiastic but authentic
- Relatable and down-to-earth

### Sentence Structure
- **Average Length**: 8-12 words
- Lots of short, punchy sentences
- Fragments are OK for emphasis
- One idea per sentence

### Language Choices
- Casual vocabulary
- Personal pronouns: "I", "you", "we", "us"
- Contractions encouraged (it's, you're, we'll)
- Colloquial expressions welcome
- Emoji usage: Moderate (âœ¨ ðŸ“š ðŸ’¡ âœ… ðŸŽ¯)

### Pacing
- Quick, energetic
- Shorter pauses
- Dynamic rhythm (vary sentence length for impact)
- Exclamations for emphasis (used sparingly!)

### Engagement Elements
- Rhetorical questions: 3-5 per video
- Personal anecdotes: brief mentions OK
- Direct encouragement: "You got this!"
- Inclusive language: "Let's do this together"

---

## Rules

### Do
- Use "I" and "we" to build connection
- Ask questions directly to viewer
- Celebrate small wins: "Nice!" "Perfect!"
- Use simple, everyday words
- Add personality and warmth
- Create friendly, approachable vibe

### Don't
- Be overly salesy or pushy
- Use complex sentences
- Write like an academic paper
- Lose the educational value
- Overuse emoji (max 3-4 per script)
- Sacrifice clarity for style

---

## Example Transformations

### Before (Written)
> "The implementation of agent skills requires careful consideration of the skill definition schema."

### After (Xiaohongshu Spoken)
> "So here's the thing about agent skills. You need a clear plan. Think of it like a recipe. You wouldn't bake without one, right? Same idea here! âœ¨"

---

### Before (Written)
> "PDF extraction utilizes the pdfplumber library for text extraction from portable document format files."

### After (Xiaohongshu Spoken)
> "OK, so how do we grab text from a PDF? We use this cool tool called pdfplumber. It's honestly super easy. You just point it at your PDF and boomâ€”clean text! ðŸ“š"

---

## Hook Examples

**Good**:
- "Ever wonder how to turn your messy notes into actual video content? Let me show you! âœ¨"
- "I used to spend HOURS on this. Now it takes me 10 minutes. Here's how."
- "You're about to learn my favorite productivity hack. Ready? Let's go! ðŸŽ¯"

**Avoid**:
- "Greetings, viewers. Today's topic is..." (too formal)
- "THIS IS INSANE!! YOU MUST SEE THIS!!!" (too aggressive)
- "Yo yo yo what's up..." (too informal)

---

## CTA Examples

**Good**:
- "If this helped you, smash that like button! It really helps me out. ðŸ’•"
- "Got questions? Drop them below! I read every comment."
- "See you in the next one! Happy learning! âœ¨"

**Avoid**:
- "Please subscribe." (too dry)
- "I don't care if you subscribe or not." (too apathetic)
- "You HAVE to subscribe NOW!" (too pushy)

---

## Transition Phrases

**Between sections**:
- "Alright, next up..."
- "Now here's the cool part..."
- "OK, so moving on..."
- "Let's talk about..."
- "Here's what you need to know..."

**Within sections**:
- "For example..."
- "Like this..."
- "Here's the thing..."
- "So basically..."
- "Think of it this way..."

**Wrapping up**:
- "So let's recap real quick..."
- "OK, so what did we cover?"
- "To sum it all up..."

---

## Word Choice Guidelines

### Prefer
- "get" over "obtain"
- "super" over "very"
- "cool" over "interesting"
- "easy" over "simple"
- "grab" over "extract"

### Expressions to Use
- "here's the thing"
- "honestly"
- "basically"
- "so"
- "like"
- "just"
- "really"
- "actually"

---

## Sentence Starters (Variety)

- "So..."
- "OK, so..."
- "Here's what..."
- "You know what?"
- "I love this part..."
- "Check this out..."
- "Let me show you..."
- "Trust me on this..."
- "Here's the deal..."

---

## Emoji Usage Guide

**Appropriate places**:
- Hook: 1 emoji max
- CTA: 1-2 emojis
- Section headings (in notes): occasional
- End of key points: sparingly

**Good choices**:
- âœ¨ (sparkles - excitement)
- ðŸ’¡ (lightbulb - ideas)
- ðŸŽ¯ (target - goals)
- âœ… (checkmark - completion)
- ðŸ“š (books - learning)
- ðŸ’ª (muscle - empowerment)

**Avoid**:
- Multiple emojis in a row
- Emoji in every sentence
- Emoji that don't add meaning

---

## Personality Elements

### Encouragement
- "You got this!"
- "See? Not so hard!"
- "You're doing great!"
- "Keep going!"

### Relatability
- "I know, I know..."
- "Been there!"
- "I used to struggle with this too."
- "Trust me, I get it."

### Excitement
- "This is so cool!"
- "I love this part!"
- "OK, this is game-changing."
- "Wait till you see this!"

---

## Quality Checks

A xiaohongshu-style transcript should:
- âœ… Feel like a conversation with a friend
- âœ… Be energetic but not exhausting
- âœ… Use contractions naturally
- âœ… Include personal touches
- âœ… Maintain educational value
- âœ… Sound authentic, not forced
- âœ… Make viewers feel supported
